item.title: CS152-lecture-20210608
item.description: How are permutations made? # To create a permutation we will Compose simple steps, each with a different mathematical structure, providing confusion and diffusion. we can use add, because it is in \( Z_{2^{32}} \) xor, because it is in \( Z_{2} \) and rotate, because it is non-linear (not represented by a linear equation) Adding on its own makes a predictable structure, but if we xor after and then rotate we can get a much more confusing structure.
